Joel Thoms

Computer Scientist

About

My love for programming started at the early age of 5 when my dad brought home a Commodore 64; I was hooked immediately. Unable to put down the C64's manual, BASIC became my first programming language.

I got my start in web hosting back in 1996. Since then having worked at multiple web hosting companies and even co-founded Host Collective, a web hosting company, (DotNetPlayground, DiscountASP, WinHost, EverLeap).

Follow Me

I have a fiery passion for functional JavaScript and I share my ideas and creativity on Medium and hackernoon. Be sure to follow me and check out my articles!
If you want to find out more of what I have done, check out my linkedin.
Follow @joel.net on twitter for tweets and retweets and the most current tech.
As I open source more of and more of my code, I am putting it up on github, including this site.
